newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold exchange volume firms, prices mixed.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold exchange volume firms, prices mixed.

text.p: Istanbul's gold exchange saw a day of mixed trade on Monday with volume rising on fresh demand.
Volume rose to 742 kilos from 550 on Friday as gold closed at $368.70 an ounce, down from $369.60 on Friday, and at 1,250,700 lira per gram versus 1,244,100.

"There was was not much activity apart from some physical demand as buyers sought to replace stocks after the weekend. Traders expect prices to continue falling. The rise in lira prices was entirely due to the lira's weakness against the dollar," one dealer said.
The Turkish currency eased against the dollar to end at 105,280 lira from 104,160 on Friday despite minor central bank intervention.
Morning trade totalled 492 kilos with 250 done in the afternoon. Almost 58 percent of the turnover was in lira terms. --Istanbul newsroom +90-212-275 08 75
